comments.body: Wrong layout. Goes `Proper Name <proper@email.xx> Commit Name <commit@email.xx>`, where commit name is `madphysicist`.

I am trying to get rid of the second line in the current output of `git log --format="%aN <%aE>" | sort -u`:

```
Joseph Fox-Rabinovitz <jfoxrabinovitz@gmail.com>
Joseph Fox-Rabinovitz <joseph.r.fox-rabinovitz@nasa.gov>
```

I did not notice that there was also this line:

```
Mad Physicist <madphysicist@users.noreply.github.com>
```
Fixed now. Sorry for making you deal with that.

Joseph Fox-Rabinovitz <jfoxrabinovitz@gmail.com> Joseph Fox-Rabinovitz <joseph.r.fox-rabinovitz@nasa.gov>
Joseph Fox-Rabinovitz <jfoxrabinovitz@gmail.com> Mad Physicist <madphysicist@users.noreply.github.com>
Julian Taylor <juliantaylor108@gmail.com> Julian Taylor <jtaylor.debian@googlemail.com>

comments.body: This should probably be removed too.
In fact all entries of the form "A <B> A <B>" and "A <B> <B>" should probably be removed.
Why? It associates a real name to the nickname.
Sorry. I clicked on the wrong line. I am pretty sure I meant `Alok Singhal <gandalf013@gmail.com> Alok Singhal <gandalf013@gmail.com>` which seems to add no new information.

Yep, looks like you are right. Entries of the form "A <B> <B>"  are valid though, remaps possible nicknames based on address. Just found some decent .mailmap documentation at https://git-scm.com/docs/git-shortlog.
Looks like some others, also. I'm not going to worry about that now but do a cleanup sometime in the future.
